## WACC and Value Creation Threshold A firm has **Equity = \$345m**, **Debt = \$161m**, **Re = 13.1**%, **Rd = 7.7**%, **Tax = 26**%. Compute the **WACC** (after tax). ::: {.question-block}
✅ **Concept:** WACC is the **blended required return** from shareholders and debtholders, after the **interest tax shield**. Formula: WACC = (E/V)·Re + (D/V)·Rd·(1 − T). **Your numbers:** WACC = (345/506)×13.1% + (161/506)×7.7%×(1−26%) = **10.74%**.
::: Suppose a project in this firm has **expected return = 12.4%**. By how many **percentage points** does the project’s return **exceed the WACC**? (This gap signals **value creation** if positive.) ::: {.question-block}
✅ **Decision rule:** If **Project Return > WACC**, the project **creates value** (positive NPV under proportional scaling). **Your numbers:** Gap = 12.4% − 10.74% = **1.66 pp**. A positive gap indicates the project clears the firm’s opportunity cost of capital.
:::
